entry.title: Interesing Thingys 30
entry.content:
This weeks list was assembled with a little help from heroku

JavaScript

  • JavaScript Physics Engines Comparison - Build New Games In this article Chandler Trall takes a look at three popular Javascript physics libraries and one that is currently in development: box2dweb, Ammo.js, JigLibJS, and Cannon.js. In this article Chandler Trall takes a look at three popular Javascript physics libraries and one that is currently in development: box2dweb, Ammo.js, JigLibJS, and Cannon.js.
  • Javascript Scope Quiz A basic quiz that teaches you JavaScript variable scope.
  • scottrabin/is-js A small library for identifying Javascript types
  • 15 Cool jQuery Animation Plugins A great selection of different animation plugins
  • http://jsplumb.org/jquery/demo.html jsPlumb allows you to connect elements on the screen using SVG, Canvas or VML, depending on the capabilities of the browser.
  • Vanilla JS Vanilla JS is a fast, lightweight, cross-platform framework for building incredible, powerful JavaScript applications.
  • Resource Reflection in Flatiron - blog.nodejitsu.com - scaling node.js applications one callback at a time. The Flatiron framework is designed to help with the rapid development of robust isomorphic JavaScript applications.
  • [CSSOM-view] Support centering an element when scrolling into view. from Thaddee Tyl on 2012-05-22 (www-style@w3.org from May 2012) Webkit supports centering an element, when you scroll it into view
  • Building and Testing a Backbone App | Nettuts+ TDD with Backbone and Jasmine
  • NVD3.js :: re-usable charts for d3.js re-usable charts and chart components for d3.js without taking away the power that d3.js gives you
  • BloatBusters - WebPerfDays - Google Docs Eliminating memory leaks in GMail using Google Chrome DevTools
  • Asynchronous JavaScript Programming. The Power Of $.Deferred for HTML5 Application - HTML5 Rocks Jeremy Chone on using $.Deferred for asynchronous HTML5 applications.

Node

  • popee/nails node on rails?
  • Why developers can’t say no to Node Nice infographic on this topic
  • Node.js: Style and structure a few tips on working with Node
  • Geddy - A Structured Node.js Framework get your nodes structured
  • substack/stream-handbook covers the basics of how to write node.js programs with streams

CSS

  • Swinging Image A swinging picture frame with CSS animation
  • Animated Radio Inputs · CodePen amazing what is possible just with plain 'old' css
  • Selectors Level 4 - W3C Working Draft 23 August 2012 lots of selectors are coming to the next generation of CSS

Web Development

  • SpritePad - Create and edit css sprites With SpritePad you can create your CSS sprites within seconds.
  • PhantomJS · marcelduran/yslow Wiki YSlow for PhantomJS is a command line script that allows page performance analysis from live URLs
  • Optimizing The Design Workflow With Extensions - Smashing Magazine | Smashing Magazine Ashish Bogawat on using Fireworks with Web Development
  • Images. Can we have less? - blog is WebP the answer?

HTML (5)

  • MontyThibault/WebMusic An experiment with the new Web Audio API for Chrome and Safari. The script can load basic sheet music data from an XML file, parse it, and play it back dynamically in the browser.
  • HTML5 download Attribute Demos for the HTML5 download attribute on links.
  • High DPI Canvas - HTML5 Rocks How to draw a canvas on a retina display
  • Integrating input[type="file"] with the Filesystem API - HTML5Rocks Updates Eric Bidelman shows how to combine the filesystem api's ability to access folders with the input type file.
  • Bruce Lawson’s personal site : Credit card, bank account numbers in HTML5 forms <input type="text" inputmode="numeric" autocomplete="cc-number"> and a ton more types coming.
  • Shaun Inman // Automatic Conditional Retina Images One line of JavaScript and a few mod_rewrite rules and we have no fuss Automatic Conditional Retina Images. No DOM crawling. No redundant requests. No server-side scripts.
  • doodlejump in html5 the classic iOS/Android game 'doodlejump' re-created in html5 .. with source!
  • jq-idealforms Build responsive HTML 5 forms
  • Complex Navigation Patterns for Responsive Design | Brad Frost Web Brad Frost shows the pros and cons of various navigations patterns
  • SitePoint Podcast #176: Web Intents in Depth with Paul Kinlan - SitePoint interview with Mr. WebIntents Paul Kinlan (@paul_kinlan) about the Web Intents API
  • Getting HTML5 Ready - ContentEditable : Remote Synthesis Explore the possibliities of conentEditable
  • Ambient light sensors and CSS Media Queries A proposal for ambient light sensor media queries, sounds interesting and can lead to new design possibilities
  • WebCamMesh – Webcam 3D Depth Map | CreativeJS demo that combines a little bit of everything: Three.js, getUserMedia(), Perlin Noise, and CSS3 Filters come together to make WebCamMesh
  • Responsive Web Above The Fold | CSS-Tricks Chris Coyier eleborates on the new challanges of responsive design and 'above the fold'

C++

  • c - Why is < faster than <=? - Stack Overflow is it really? find out...

Ruby

  • Polish Your Gems As Ruby developers, we often forget how good we have it. We’ve got a awesome library distribution system in Rubygems, we use a powerful and flexible language that just begs to be used for DSLs and a culture of open development and community improvement.
  • Modular front-end code in Rails by Arjan van der Gaag Maintainable stylesheets of non-trivial size need a modular design — so much has been established by now. How can you incorporate this style of front-end coding in a typical Rails application?
  • Building Web Apps with Active Admin | REVERB Active Admin isn't solely for backend admin interfaces, it can be 'a great framework for building the customer facing part' of webapps to
  • pry to the rescue super-fast, painless, debugging for the (ruby) masses

Browsers

  • Firefox 15 available to download, finally fixes add-on memory leak | ExtremeTech finally!
  • Chromium 23, CodeMirror Editing and a flag for CSS Exclusions « Peter Beverloo Lots of things landed in Chromium 23, read on...
  • #AltDevBlogADay » Using Chrome://tracing to view your inline profiling data Colt McAnlis on how to use chrome://tracing

Python

  • PythonBooks - Learn Python the easy way ! The best free Python resources

Mobile

  • Mobile Apps: HTML5 vs Native some toughts on native vs. html5 apps in regard to the recent native Facebook app.

Programming

  • algorithm - Lazy Evaluation and Time Complexity - Stack Overflow How can minimum = head . sort be O(n)?
  • Radical Thoughts | Dayley Agile is agile still radical?
  • 20 controversial programming opinions « Programmers Stack Exchange Blog The top 20 answers to Jon Skeet’s “What’s your most controversial programming opinion?”
  • Why is Clean Code suggesting avoiding protected variables? - Programmers asked on programmers.stackexchange.com

Tools

  • TCP Port Scanner in Bash - good coders code, great reuse Go Bash, go!!

Performance

  • Web Performance Power Tool: HTTP Archive (HAR) - igvita.com Ilya Grigorik shows how to analyse HAR files

Security

  • Unpatched Java Vulnerability Exploited in Targeted Attacks, Researchers Say | PCWorld Business Center Attackers are exploiting a new and unpatched vulnerability that affects the latest version of Java

Databases

  • The MongoDB NoSQL Database Blog, MongoDB 2.2 Released with lots of new features and performance improvements

Watching

  • Make The Web Fast - The HAR Show: Capturing and Analyzing performance data with HTTP Archive format - YouTube Need a flexible format to record, export, and analyze network performance data? Well, that's exactly what the HTTP Archive format (HAR) is designed to do!
  • Rich Hickey: Deconstructing the Database - YouTube Rich Hickey presents a new way to look at database architectures
  • What the #$%@ is UX Design? - YouTube A mixture between minute physics and prezi style presentation explains what User eXperience is
  • Fun Programming 120 Videos for learning creative programming

Reading

  • Functional Programming for… the Object Oriented Programmer

Listening

  • The Non Breaking Space Show Non Breaking Space is a show where we’ll seek out the best, brightest and smartest people on the web and talk to them about how and why they do what they do.
  • CODING.FM The sound of coding

Miscellaneous

  • How to Give (Negative) Feedback Effectively Dos and Donts on how to give feedback
  • How to Secure your Dropbox Account with 2-Step Verification Dropbox introduced 2 step authentification, just like Google
  • River (getriver.com): Keep a programming journal. — Gist on writing toughts down - physically
  • Principles of User Interface Design 20 principles - easy to understand
  • Lobsters a hackernews alternative

Fun

  • Concetto 2012 Play SuperMario to navigate this site

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesing Thingys 29
entry.content:
What a week! Lots of exciting new stuff went on in the web community, read on…

JavaScript

  • Dojo 1.8 Released! | The Dojo Toolkit Blog
  • Yehuda Katz on Ember.js's one-to-many associations
  • Avgrund - A modal UI concept
  • JavaScript Events And Responding To The User | Smashing Coding
  • jQuery Blog » jQuery 1.8 box-sizing: width(), css(“width”), and outerWidth()
  • Front-end Unit Testing with JavaScript | Danny Croft - Web Developer made in Wales but working in London 
  • Meet Crockford’s JSCheck | Nettuts+
  • Dependency management with RequireJS | Adobe Developer Connection
  • Proof of Concept - Build a download feature for IndexedDB

Libraries && Tools

  • Socialite.js
    Socialite provides a very easy way to implement and activate a plethora of social sharing buttons
  • addyosmani/getUserMedia.js
    shim with flash fallback
  • borismus/srcset-polyfill
    A spec-compatible, unit-tested polyfill for
  • antimatter15/whammy
    A real time javascript webm encoder based on a canvas hack
  • imsky/holder
    Holder renders image placeholders entirely on the client side.
  • dfcb/BigVideo.js
    play full screen video as web site background

CSS

  • 256 Classes Overrides One ID · CodePen
  • Bootstrap 2.1.0 released · Twitter Bootstrap Blog
  • Don't Overthink It Grids | CSS-Tricks
  • Full-page Animations Using CSS - IEBlog - Site Home - MSDN Blogs
  • Container-relative floats · CodePen

HTML(5)

  • Towards A Retina Web | Smashing Coding
  • High DPI Images for Variable Pixel Densities - HTML5 Rocks
  • HTML5 Accessibility - Tips and Tools -- Slide #0

Mobile

  • Separate Mobile Website Vs. Responsive Website | Smashing Mobile

WebDevelopment

  • 10 common UX mistakes startups make ... and how to avoid them! | Feature | .net magazine
  • TeamUp Launches Fully HTML5 3D Modeling Application: Multi-Optics - Bright Side Of News*
  • The innovations of Internet Explorer | NCZOnline

Ruby

  • DCI with Ruby Refinements :: Mike Pack Development
  • twe4ked/rspec-nc - rspec formatter for Mountain Lion

JVM

  • VijayKiran.com – Web Application Development with Clojure – Part 1
  • Futures and Promises in Scala 2.10 // Speaker Deck

.Net

  • Visual Studio 2012 and .NET Framework 4.5 released to the web! - Jason Zander's blog - Site Home - MSDN Blogs

Databases

  • Cassandra Summit 2012 Presentations | DataStax

Browsers

  • Chrome Web Store - Intents Debugger - Dev Tools Extension
  • Firefox: 341604 – Implement HTML5 sandbox attribute for IFRAMEs

Editors

  • Chris Granger - Light Table reaches 0.1.0
  • dwm.vim - Tiled Window Management for Vim : vim online
  • Vim - Putting arrows to use

Coding Practices

  • Make Your Tests Deterministic - How To Node - NodeJS
  • asp.net mvc - Should sorting logic be placed in the model, the view, or the controller? - Stack Overflow
  • If You Think You Need to Go Agile but Are Afraid of the Agile Mindset | Net Objectives

Miscellaneous

  • IMDB API, IMDB web service
  • Monads in Pictures » Lost in Technopolis | Lost in Technopolis
  • NoSQL Guide - Martin Fowler
  • A geek with a hat » The birth of LISP – a summary of John McCarthy’s original paper

Watching

  • Ido Flatow - Debugging the Web with Fiddler on Vimeo
  • Beyond the DOM: Sane Structure for JS Apps by Rebecca Murphey - YouTube
  • Git Extras - Introduction on Vimeo
  • Testing Best Practices, or The Five Habits of Highly Effective Tests - Noel Rappin - RailsConf 2012
  • The Boston Ruby Group - Ruby and Ruby on Rails Meetings, Project Nights, and Community

Fun

  • Turn Your Phone Into a Server with Servers Ultimate – xda-developers
  • Ascii Street View
  • Rey Bango - Google+ - Week in the life of a programmer

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesing Thingys 28
entry.content:
This week two projects turned 1.0, normalize.css and goliath.

JavaScript

  • square/cane
    Fails your build if code quality thresholds are not met.

Libraries && Tools

  • What's New in jQuery 1.8 - SitePoint
  • Sketch.js - Simple Canvas-based Drawing for jQuery

CSS

  • Circle Hover Effects with CSS Transitions

HTML(5)

  • cjdsie/wirefy
    Wirefy is a responsive wireframe boilerplate for rapidly experimenting with layouts to create the best user experience.
  • The Many Faces of ‘Mobile First’ | Brad Frost Web
  • Glazing ribbon screensaver effect in HTML5 canvas
  • Dazed Digital - Field Project
  • [datalist] for range/color inputs offer some default choices - HTML5Rocks Updates

Mobile

WebDevelopment

  • Behind the scenes: visualizing the evolution of the web - Google Developers Blog
  • Bezier Sim · CodePen

Ruby

  • postrank-labs/goliath - v1.0
  • RubySource | Narihiro Nakamura: Ruby’s GC InnovatorRubySource
  • 065 RR Functional vs Object Oriented Programming with Michael Feathers
  • Plinq/big_spoon
    Adds before and after hooks to any method, because that's just how things should be
  • Haskell-like list comprehensions in Ruby — Gist

Java

  • pcpratts/rootbeer1
    The Rootbeer GPU Compiler makes it easy to use Graphics Processing Units from within Java.

Databases

  • HBase FuzzyRowFilter: Alternative to Secondary Indexes « Sematext Blog
  • Designing MongoDB Schemas with Embedded, Non-Embedded and Bucket Structures | OpenShift by Red Hat

Browsers

  • Lets Tincr: Bi-directional Editing And Saving With The Chrome DevTools

Editors

  • The problem with Vim
  • VimGolf - Prime Numbers

    gitk like plugin for vim / fugutive

Tools

  • maccman/go
    Go is a super simple Sinatra URL shortener for use behind the firewall.

Programming

  • nsf/gocode
    An autocompletion daemon for the Go programming language
  • 10 practices of highly ineffective software developers - Computerworld
  • The Clean Architecture | 8th Light
  • #AltDevBlogADay » Floating-point complexities
  • The Gang of Four is wrong and you don't understand delegation - Saturn Flyer with Jim Gay

Miscellaneous

  • The Art Of Staying Up To Date | Smashing Magazine
  • The Curiosity Rover Nuclear Battery Explained To All
  • Running Dart in the Cloud with Heroku | Seth Ladd's Blog
  • How to crawl a quarter billion webpages in 40 hours | DDI
  • Arms Trade
    WebGL visualization of small arms and amunition trade

Watching

  • GeeCON 2012: Kevlin Henney - Cool Code on Vimeo
  • Lang.NEXT 2012 | Channel 9 - Videos now online
  • Cube Drone - Automated Testing & Inversion of Control - YouTube
  • Keynote GOTO: Rich Hickey - The Value of Values
  • Skills Matter : The London Clojure Community:Functional comp

Fun

  • 765645 – Millions of web pages use the -moz-opacity:0.7 tag and in javascript. It's broken now since FF 13.01. Please can you "alias" it back into your main browser code. Thanks.

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesing Thingys 27
entry.content:
What a week! Here comes a massive link bomb, behold!

JavaScript

  • Build Cross Browser Extensions with JavaScript & jQuery - Crossrider.com
  • Mike West - Google+ - An experimental Content Security Policy feature detection…
  • Asynchronous JavaScript Testing in Jasmine, Mocha, and Vows | The Carbon Emitter
  • A critical review of ECMAScript 6 quasi-literals | NCZOnline
  • Rich JavaScript Applications – the Seven Frameworks (Throne of JS, 2012) - Steve Sanderson’s blog - As seen on YouTube™
  • Automating Unit Tests | Blog | Sencha
  • jQuery Geo - JavaScript mapping API
  • Scaling node.js to 100k concurrent connections! | caustik's blog
  • justGage.com - JustGage is a handy JavaScript plugin for generating and animating nice & clean gauges.
  • Leak Finder: a new tool for JavaScript - Google Open Source Blog
  • Getting Bitwise with JavaScript - Bocoup
  • Managing JavaScript on Responsive Websites | Viget

Libraries && Tools

  • Jam - The JavaScript package manager
  • Announcing jQuery Mobile 1.2.0 Alpha | jQuery Mobile
  • Using the D3.js Visualization Library with AngularJS
  • Meteor 0.3.9 - Search engine optimization
  • Ember.js - Ember 1.0 Prerelease
  • swank-js/swank-js
    swank-js provides SLIME REPL and other development tools
  • lipka/piecon tiny javascript library for generating progress pie charts in your favicon

CSS

  • redroot/holmes
  • Poll Results: How do you order your CSS properties? | CSS-Tricks
  • Greatest tool for sorting CSS properties in specific order
  • demosthenes.info – Convert Images To Black And White With CSS

HTML(5)

  • Drag and drop a folder onto Chrome now available - HTML5Rocks Updates
  • Making of the World Wonders 3D Globe - HTML5 Rocks
  • Five things you didn't know the web could do | Feature | .net magazine
  • Supertux Web Preview - HTML5 port
  • Quick FAQs on input[type=date] in Google Chrome - HTML5Rocks Updates
  • Radar - An audio-visual HTML experiment

Mobile

  • Mobile Frameworks Comparison Chart

WebDevelopment

  • ZeitOnline/briefkasten
    a reasonably secure web application for submitting content anonymously
  • Responsify.it - A responsive template generator - StumbleUpon
  • Should We Kill the CAPTCHA? | Design Shack
  • Nodefront by karthikv

Ruby

  • Why Rails 4 Live Streaming is a big deal – Phusion Corporate Blog
  • Synchronized Times In Ruby & JavaScript Acceptance Tests Using Capybara, Timecop & Sinon.JS @MetaSkills.net

Clojure

  • sudoku_compact.clj — Gist - Sudoku solver in33 lines of Clojure

Databases

  • Memcached in Mysql 5.6 -MySQL :: MySQL 5.6 Reference Manual :: D.1.1 Changes in MySQL 5.6.6 (Not yet released, Milestone 9)

Browsers

  • Web Platform Status (chromestatus.com) - The Chromium Projects

Editors

  • vimwiki - Personal Wiki for Vim - Google Project Hosting
  • A mapping to ease the edit/compile/edit workflow : vim
  • textmate/textmate - is open source now
  • Ecukes - Ecukes is a testing tool for Emacs based on Cucumber.

Productivity

  • bash terminal Keyboard shortcuts

Miscellaneous

  • Rob Pike - Google+ - A lesson in shortcuts. Long ago, as the design of the Unix…
    Rob explains the origin of dot files
  • Design Tip: Never Use Black by Ian Storm Taylor
  • ircmaxell's blog: Reinvent The Wheel!
  • Halide

Security

  • Troy Hunt: Lessons in website security anti-patterns by Tesco

SPDY

  • SPDY and WebSockets | The CTO's Blog
  • SPDY on Rails - Bugsnag Blog

Hacking

  • gist.io
    Writing for hackers
  • Give your Commodore 64 new life with an SD card reader - Steve Hanov's Programming Blog
  • Self Extracting Png » Checkout the source.

Watching

  • 10 Conference Videos for Front-End Developers | Impressive Webs
  • TED Talk - Michael Hansmeyer: Building unimaginable shapes
  • Breaking Good Habits - Harry Roberts
